revised_title: Intracellular Pupil Mechanism and Photoreceptor Signal-to-Noise Ratios in the Fly Lucilia cuprina
tldr: The study investigates the intracellular pupil mechanism and its effect on photoreceptor signal-to-noise ratios in the fly Lucilia cuprina. The researchers found that the pupil mechanism helps prevent receptor saturation and extends the range of intensities at which fly photoreceptors operate near their maximum signal-to-noise ratio. The study also provides estimates of the number of transduction units generating photoreceptor responses and the effective attenuation caused by the pupil.
